intro: Sida phaeotricha, commonly known as the silverleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in disturbed soils. Sida phaeotricha is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
